Replies.Reply: Written by  Peter Weir    Inspired by the book "The Long Walk"
What've you got?
Think I want your stinking lice farm?
For the bread.
Throw in that crappy shirt you're wearing and I might be tempted. Smiles from the gang. VALKA knows he's being mocked but he's desperate. His eyes flick down to the sausage.
I don't play for regulation issue crap.
You're already in debt.
Was that really necessary?
OK. For the sausage.
Keep going and you'll get some bread - so how does this 'Long John Silver' find the treasure?
Shut up.
Go on.
Polish tailor.
See? From Krakov. Good as new.
And the sausage.
Bohdan, you're a dog's prick, I swear. I hope you die with an axe in your skull, and your balls ripped out.
OK. For the bread.
Come here.
Take off your coat.
Worth shit!
You.
Let's have the sweater.
I want the sweater.
You do for me.
No. Not me.
There are no secrets here.
The game goes against me. Small debt - lose fingers. Big debt, they take head. Me, big debt.
In forest you need knife to survive. Without? A miracle.
You need a knife, and I need miracle to get me out of here.
What?
You stare at me like the snake at the rabbit or is it the other way 'round?
He teach me English. Speak good, huh? Bread for words, wasn't it cowboy?
Less, if we've been going in circles, like the chicken without its head.
He was going to inform. Don't worry. I talk to him. Everything o.k.
For direction he looks at grass and mosses, what's that? I swear to God he better know what he's doing.
Gratitude is for dogs.
Man on run - one tiny piece of sand can make cripple, I swear to God.
You are the 'Pakhan'.
Boss of criminals.
I swear to God you win my respect with your sticks and pine-cones.
It's the Urka way. You have me and you have the Wolf.
To Mongolia? No. I go further.
We need meat.
We find farms, villages, get food there.
We steal it. At night. They never know.
Then I'll steal it, and I'll eat.
Young always die first.
In the camps.
Still, one less mouth to feed what? You're all thinking the same thing.
Who will be first?
I think that sucker, the artist.
More soft. More tender.
Mister only gets little fish now. We must have meat, or we die. You're the Pakhan, you've thought of it. We all have. That's why you brought extra people isn't it?
You said we should have seen Lake a week ago. We're lost, Pakhan.
I come too.
I swear to God, those mother-
No? I think you've killed before.
What does she want?
I swear to God I know this type -
Pakhan. Don't do this.
Why do we do this?
Quicker through it.

So.
Hey, easy cowboy!
'Fool' is it?
What? Did I kill you ask? Yes.
And it's my birthday!
In Russia that means we drink!
You know when they put the children of the political prisoners in the orphanage, they change their names, so later, the parents can never find them.
I didn't have parents. But that's what happened to her.
Isn't it? You told me that.
She lived in the streets, like me!
A cross for your tombstone.
Why should you care what I'm making?
What?
You think it's funny? They are great men.
Watch your eyes, crowbait!
Don't you know what 'Stalin' means funny man? Man-of-Steel. He takes from rich and gives to poor.
Prison is o.k. Debt is bad. But there are many prisons. They don't find me.
It's not for me - 'Freedom'.
So we must say goodbye, my Wolf and me.
You don't need him any more.
Good luck, Pakhan.
Take the coat.
You have no authority, here.
Here he is.
He's not frozen yet, that's lucky.
Keep your voice down, be grateful there's anything left.
American.
Stalin doesn't like foreigners.
I love you Poles, your burning sense of injustice, your yearning for freedom.
Khabarov. Andrei Timofeyevich.
And your 'prayer', may I ask?

Ten years?
58.14. Sabotage, ten years.
And you were in the cavalry?
Oh there's that Polish spirit! I observe things - your demeanor, your, may I say, certain 'swagger'. 'Cavalryman', that's how I'd cast you.
We've been waiting for you.. .Poor Poland, Hitler invades from the West.. .World War,. .days later, Stalin from the East.

Usual tactics - they torture a close friend who names you as a spy - a neighbor? Your old school teacher? A friend?
I was an actor - moving pictures.
It was claimed I was elevating the status of the old nobility.
I've had better notices.
The 'Urki'.
Professional criminals, your ordinary run of the mill murderers and thieves, don't stare at them.
They are considered the by-product of bourgeoisie society and therefore 'Friends of the People'.
From the far reaches of the Soviet Empire - all scooped up in the net like so many minnows, poor creatures.
You should be more careful.
In a camp like this you'll be dead in a year. If not literally then in spirit.
Eleven months and twenty-nine days.
Good night, friend.

Cut last year and never collected!
He knows, but he doesn't care, as long as his arse is protected.

The mines. They blast at night.
Shirt.
You'll see.
It can be done.

Lazar, you've seen him, my associate, overseer of construction.
Few ever escape the camps. I've waited for someone like you, someone with the strength and will to see it through.
We believe about 500 kilometers north of Lake Baikal.
Then on to the Trans-Siberian Railway. Cross that and you're close to the Mongolian border.
Spring is already upon us. It would have to be next autumn.

If you trust them. But they won't all survive.

How long will that last?
It can't be done!
I don't know what you're talking about.
Damn! Picked clean! Bloody thieves.
Planning to survive on half rations, son?
I'm an old man. But I'll be alive in the morning. He won't.
'Kindness'. That can kill you here. You'll learn that.
We need to make shelter.
We'll freeze to death in less than an hour.
Yes, but lose 200 men and you'll have some forms to fill out.
We could move into the forest, find shelter!
Smith.
Mister.
That's right.
Are you crazy? They'll shoot you.

The actor.
He has no intention of escaping.
He's aliar. Been here foryears -seeksout new arrivals, mewhen Ifirstcame here. He justlikes totalkabout escape. I'veknown others like him.
Nothing is for nothing in the camps. From you he gets your energy, your spirit. You feed his 'dream' of escape. You help keep him alive. He's no more than a leech.
I'm still alive, that's all I know. But I won't be in six months. And neither will you.
Can't be done alone. Besides you have a weakness that could be useful to me.
Compassion. If anything happens to me, I'm counting on you carrying me.
We've got to make fire!
We die either way, might as well die warm.
You've made a bargain with the Devil.
You should be grateful you're here at all.
Barbed-wire.
Then you'll die.
Save your philosophy. Concentrate on keeping up with us instead.
I made a mistake.
I know. Valka.
Good luck.

Something about a loose brick.
You know if you don't pull through soon we'll have to leave you.
So you better get better quick if you want to see home again.
We're going to have to follow the   Western shore.
We're being followed.
Fifty yards back. A man on his own. May have seen us - crossed into the trees beside the track.
He gives us away, the soldiers will be on us in no time.
What? What is it?
She wants to travel with us?
We can't feed ourselves.
We have no choice.
That right.
Speak to Valka about her. He doesn't even think she's Polish.
It's decided then?
Apart from food she'll slow us down. There's no room for sentimentality. You know that.
Can you swim?
You wouldn't lie to me?
And don't call me, 'comrade'.
Janusz tells me your family were Kulaks?
Were your parents arrested with you?
You can't swim can you?
You've never been in the water in your life.
And, you said you lived on a farm near Warsaw?
The Soviets didn't get that far.
Your parents weren't murdered were they? You made it all up.

We're wasting time.
What is it? What's wrong?
He was behind Zoran.
He could turn us in for the bounty.
He'd bribe his way out of it.
Could have got us all killed.
Fool!

Yes.
No. American.

Yes.

Days?

You caught her smile. SMITH passes the sketch to JANUSZ as TOMASZ lays back down, a smile on his face. He looks up at the stars. He knows he's dying and has accepted the fact. This in turn has given strength to his friends, and between them all is a feeling of love and a kind of peace.
They also fly long distances.
It can kill you, remember?
'Kindness'.

Twenty.

He knows.

Can't go West - apart from the Soviets, there's the Germans.
